reviews.review_msg: Love this guy. Took it his course as an elective and it was actually really interesting.

Super easy prof and very generous with marks. I got one of the highest marks on the midterm and i didnt even open the textbook! One paper, and a final. The final was an essay and it was take home style. Super chill prof, just put a bit of effort and it will go a long way.
The best prof ever; fair grading framework and is very friendly. I would highly recommend him!!
Kevin is a amazing GPA booster Professor.
Best prof ever, really nice with the marks.
Would highly recommend him. Easy professor.
The best prof in the department. Kevin is friendly, very experienced, cares for his students and teaches real life politics. Easy to understand.
Kevin is a easy marker and teaches the material in a practical way. He is also very caring of his students. Fun teacher.
The best prof ever!

Very unorganized and vague criteria. Required weekly summaries of readings and group presentations but would push back each groups presentation so many groups did not have to present. Participation is worth 20% but not once did he take attendance.

Easy marker, if you know anything about politics you'll do great. However as a professor.. oh boy. Terrible with communication, vague syllabus, incomplete responses to emails, disorganized, and monotoned. I don't care how well I did in that class I would rather chew on cardboard than have him again. He takes interesting content and makes it hell.

Great prof. Ive taken a bunch of classes with Kevin and Ive gotten an A in all of them. He lays out what he wants very clearly and his exams hold no surprises. If you cant manage to get a good mark in his class the issue is you. Im amazed that so many people complain. How do you complain when your prof makes everything clear and simple?

Lazy, inconsistent, confusing, unclear, unorganized, mono-toned, unpredictable, no communication with students, no grading criteria, changes expectations for assignments depending when you ask him about them, says he'll post slides online and then doesn't, he just reads from the slides, gets irrationally upset at people who are late, just awful.

talks very quiet and monotone.. reads off the lecture slides and does not give time for you to take the notes down before changing slides. Very boring and mentions "capacity" a lot without explanation.
Very dry and hard to follow, talks like reading out of a dictionary; not passionate or inspirational.
His reviews for Douglas College are much more accurate. Save yourself.
He is so friendly and knows how to teach properly. Highly respected!!!
The best prof in the department. He is good with the marking and gives clear instructions on how to excel in class. Please take him!!
The Best Professor in the department in every measure. Do the work and you'll fly.
He is very informative and cares about your grade but his lectures can get boring. Everything was good aside from that.

Took his pol 221 course online. This was my first distance ed class but it was a fair class. Not very available in terms of office hours etc, but exams and research papers are very fair with clear grading criteria. Would definitely take a class with him again.

An amazing professor. Expectations are clear, his marking  sticks to them, if you follow his instructions for exam prep and the paper, you're set. He's super knowledgeable, fair in his marking, lectures are well prepared, and the slides are posted online. Expect a presentation, midterm, final, and 4000 word paper, and very reasonable readings.

I cannot say enough good things about Kevin G. I've taken 3 courses with him over my time at SFU and its clear that he cares about the students and the subject matter. Just show up to class, read the textbook and follow his instructions for papers and you're golden. He really sets you up well for success.

Great prof. Super friendly and makes you laugh even though the material can be pretty dry at times. Very clear and concise lectures and tutorials are extremely helpful, especially for writing the final paper/memo. He gave us a take home final exam too, which was fantastic. I definitely recommend this class if you're interested in Canadian politics.

Never even took the textbook out of it's wrapper. Fantastically easy course if you've got even the slightest interest in politics. But beware the criminology students taking this course. You'll constantly fear for the future of the human race with the crap that falls out of their mouths in tutorial.

The class is super easy; for exams you just need to "memorize" two lectures for the midterm and 3 for the final.  Write down everything from the lecture even if it doesn't seem relevant.  Start the memo early and do it on a topic you're actually interested in.  He's always available for help.  And he's quite funny, especially for an 8:30 am class.
Fair marker, very approachable and helpful. Specialized in local government and policy decisions.  Has a good sense of humor, and generally fair lecturing style using powerpoints.
